str2: A primary interjection; as a sign of the vocative case, O; as a note of exclamation, oh.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Vocative Feminine Singular
str2: To pervert, corrupt, oppose, distort. From dia and strepho; to distort, i.e. misinterpret, or corrupt.
From genos; a generation; by implication, an age.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: To endure, bear with, have patience with, suffer, admit, persist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From an adverb form of hode; in this same spot, i.e. Here or hither.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
